questions.text: Does your phone/computer lock automatically?
questions.explanation: Prevents unauthorized access if you walk away
questions.actionHint: Set auto-lock to 5 minutes or less

questions.text: Do you let your browser save and generate passwords?
questions.explanation: Instant unique passwords for every account
questions.actionHint: Chrome/Edge/Safari all have built-in password managers

questions.text: DEBUG: Test expiration system (expires immediately)
questions.explanation: This is a debug question that expires immediately to test the expiration system
questions.actionHint: This is for testing only

questions.text: Is two-factor authentication (2FA) enabled on your main email?
questions.explanation: Your email is the key to everything - protect it first!
questions.actionHint: Gmail: Settings > Security > 2-Step Verification

questions.text: Is 2FA enabled on your banking/financial accounts?
questions.explanation: Protects your money - highest priority
questions.actionHint: Log into your bank > Security Settings > Enable 2FA

questions.text: How often do you reuse the same password? (1=Always, 5=Never)
questions.explanation: One breach shouldn't compromise all accounts
questions.actionHint: Use your browser's password generator for new accounts

questions.text: Is 2FA enabled on your social media accounts?
questions.explanation: Prevents account hijacking and impersonation
questions.actionHint: Check security settings on Facebook, Instagram, Twitter

questions.text: Do you have antivirus software running?
questions.explanation: Basic malware protection
questions.actionHint: Windows Defender is free and built-in, or try Malwarebytes

questions.text: Is your firewall turned on?
questions.explanation: Blocks unauthorized network connections
questions.actionHint: Windows: Settings > Network > Windows Defender Firewall

questions.text: How often do you update Windows?
questions.explanation: Regular updates patch security vulnerabilities
questions.actionHint: Windows Settings > Update & Security > Windows Update

actionOptions.impact: Perfect! Your system stays protected automatically.
Good practice! We'll check in periodically to make sure you're staying current.
This leaves you vulnerable between updates. We'll remind you monthly to stay secure.
This is very risky! Unpatched systems are prime targets. Let's fix this immediately.

questions.text: Is your hard drive encrypted?
questions.explanation: Protects data if device is stolen
questions.actionHint: Windows: BitLocker, Mac: FileVault, built into most phones

questions.text: How often do you update Windows?
questions.explanation: Security patches are critical for protection
questions.actionHint: Automatic updates are recommended for best security

questions.text: Have you disabled USB autorun?
questions.explanation: Prevents malware from USB drives auto-executing
questions.actionHint: Windows: gpedit.msc > Computer Config > Admin Templates > Windows Components > Autoplay Policies

questions.text: Have you installed the latest Windows updates?
questions.explanation: Since you update manually, let's make sure you're current
questions.actionHint: Check Windows Settings > Update & Security > Check for updates

actionOptions.impact: Excellent! Keep this good habit up.
Great! Installing the latest updates will close security gaps.
Let's get you caught up! Updates patch critical vulnerabilities.

questions.text: When did you last update Windows?
questions.explanation: Since you update sporadically, let's establish a routine
questions.actionHint: Set a monthly calendar reminder to check for updates

actionOptions.impact: Not bad! Try to make this a monthly habit for better security.
You're likely missing important security patches. Let's update now!
This is very risky! Your system has known vulnerabilities that need patching immediately.

questions.text: Are you ready to enable automatic Windows updates?
questions.explanation: Manual updating hasn't worked - let's automate your security
questions.actionHint: Windows Settings > Update & Security > Advanced options > Automatic

actionOptions.impact: Perfect! Your system will now stay protected automatically.
Okay, we'll check in weekly to make sure you follow through.
This leaves you very vulnerable. We'll keep checking in frequently.

questions.text: Install uBlock Origin Ad Blocker
questions.explanation: Blocks malicious ads and trackers
questions.actionHint: Available in Chrome, Firefox, and Edge extension stores

actionOptions.impact: Excellent! You're protected from malicious ads that could lead to fake sites or download malware.
Great choice! This will block ads that could redirect you to malicious sites or trick you into downloading malware.
That's okay! In the meantime, be extra careful about clicking on ads - they might lead you to fake sites designed to steal your information.
No problem, everyone has their preferences! Just remember to be cautious with ads - avoid clicking on suspicious ads that promise unrealistic deals or claim your computer is infected.

questions.text: Do you check for HTTPS (lock icon) on websites?
questions.explanation: Ensures your data is encrypted in transit
questions.actionHint: Look for the lock icon in the address bar, avoid sites without it

questions.text: How often do you download software from official sources? (1=Never, 5=Always)
questions.explanation: Official sources are less likely to contain malware
questions.actionHint: Use app stores, official websites, or trusted repositories

questions.text: How careful are you with email attachments? (1=Open everything, 5=Very cautious)
questions.explanation: Email attachments are a common malware vector
questions.actionHint: Scan attachments, verify sender, be suspicious of unexpected files

questions.text: Do you backup your phone to the cloud?
questions.explanation: Don't lose your photos and contacts!
questions.actionHint: iPhone: iCloud Backup, Android: Google Backup - usually automatic

questions.text: Do you backup important files (photos, documents)?
questions.explanation: Protects against ransomware and hardware failure
questions.actionHint: Google Drive, OneDrive, or Dropbox - 15GB+ free

questions.text: How often do you backup important data? (1=Never, 5=Daily/Automatic)
questions.explanation: Regular backups minimize data loss
questions.actionHint: Set up automatic daily backups to cloud storage

questions.text: Have you ever tested restoring from your backup?
questions.explanation: Untested backups may not work when you need them
questions.actionHint: Try restoring a single file to verify backup works

questions.text: Does your home WiFi use WPA2/WPA3 security?
questions.explanation: Prevents neighbors from using your internet and snooping
questions.actionHint: Check router settings - avoid WEP or open networks

questions.text: How careful are you on public WiFi? (1=Use normally, 5=Very cautious)
questions.explanation: Public WiFi can be monitored by attackers
questions.actionHint: Avoid sensitive activities, use your phone's hotspot instead

questions.text: Have you changed your router's default admin password?
questions.explanation: Default passwords are publicly known
questions.actionHint: Access router settings (usually 192.168.1.1) and change admin password

questions.text: Do you use a VPN when needed?
questions.explanation: Encrypts traffic and hides location
questions.actionHint: Many routers have built-in VPN, or use services like ProtonVPN

suites.title: Advanced Security Features
suites.description: Unlocked when you demonstrate strong basic security practices

questions.text: Do you use hardware security keys (like YubiKey) for 2FA?
questions.explanation: Hardware keys provide the strongest form of 2FA protection
questions.actionHint: Consider YubiKey or similar FIDO2 security keys
